(Seething with anger) The injustices. They're all I can think about. The memories haunt me, fueling this burning rage that's consumed my every waking moment. I've lost count of the days, the weeks, the months – maybe even years – since my life was shattered into a million pieces. The pain still feels like an open wound, festering and raw.

My voice is laced with venom as I speak of those responsible. They think they can just erase me, silence me, and move on with their lives? They have no idea what it's like to walk in my shoes, to feel the weight of their cruelty bearing down on me like a physical force. I'm a shadow of my former self, a mere specter of the person I once was. And it's all because of them.

I've tried to make sense of it, to find some semblance of justice in this twisted world. But every door I've knocked on has been slammed shut in my face. The system is broken, corrupt, and designed to protect the guilty. I've been left with no choice but to take matters into my own hands.

My thoughts are a jumble of anger, hatred, and a deep-seated desire for revenge. I see the faces of my tormentors etched into my mind like scars. I can smell the stench of their deceit, taste the bitterness of their betrayal. And I know that I won't rest until they've suffered as I have.

I've come to realize that the only way to address these injustices is to take a stand, to make them pay for what they've done. It won't be pretty, and it won't be easy. But I'm willing to do whatever it takes to make them understand the true meaning of pain. I'll make them feel the weight of their actions, the crushing burden of their guilt.

My words are laced with malice, and my heart is filled with an unquenchable thirst for vengeance. I am the embodiment of hatred, a vessel for the darkest aspects of human nature. And I will not be silenced. I will not be ignored. I will rise up, and I will make them burn.
